page.title: 01Wylye and the Langfords
page.content: Our D Block is full of fields with rough grazing and crops and in between the hills there is the River Wylye and then there are two villages, Wylye and Langford and the population of Wylye is 250 and of Langfords is about 400. There are lots of different types of houses. There are brick and flint and thatched and tiled roofs and there are old cottages and new houses. There are quite a lot of jobs about the village because there is cleaning the river and shop keeping and farms to work on and domestic work and then after a hard days work there are lots of nice walks over the lovely countryside.
